creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by H. Ed Robison, in memory of his beloved wife Ulrike Pietzner Robison
description: blocky, human-like figure rendered in brown, black, and grey, wearing white skirt stands on one foot; six arms in various positions in the air; black hair in bun on top of head; figure casts three shadows: one large shadow at R in black; shadow above and behind figure in reddish-brown; and smaller shadow behind figure's legs in grey
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
title: Ashura
